title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Mahanagar Gas to Invest ₹1,325 Cr in New Projects
items.author: Sharmistha Mukherjee, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- *Mahanagar Gas Ltd* plans to invest ₹1,325 crore to establish a battery manufacturing facility and a biogas plant.
- The initiative aligns with government goals for *cleaner mobility solutions* and expanding into *non-fossil fuel businesses*.
- A joint venture with *International Battery Company* aims to produce lithium-ion batteries, with initial operations planned in Karnataka.

items.title: Industrial and Warehousing Demand in India Hits High
items.summary:
- Industrial and warehousing demand in India grew significantly, hitting *20 million sq ft* in H1 2025, a *33% year-on-year increase*.
- *Delhi-NCR and Chennai* accounted for half of this leasing activity, with key markets like Bhiwandi and Oragadam showing strong space uptake.
- The growth is driven by *Third Party Logistics (3PL)* and notable increases in demand from sectors like engineering, e-commerce, and automotive.

items.title: Ludhiana Launches C&D Waste Processing Plant
items.author: Nidhi Bhardwaj, TNN
items.summary:
- Ludhiana's civic body has inaugurated a new *construction and demolition (C&D)* waste processing plant to combat illegal dumping.  
- Located in *Dhandhari*, the ₹7.39 crore facility will process up to 100 tonnes of waste daily and convert it into reusable materials like tiles and bricks.  
- This initiative, part of the **Swachh Bharat Mission**, aims to improve city cleanliness and manage waste efficiently after years of planning and delays.

items.title: Iron Ore Prices Surge on Strong China Demand
items.summary:
- *Iron ore futures* prices rose 1.3% on the Dalian Commodity Exchange, reaching **781.5 yuan** per metric ton due to increased steel demand. 
- *Production curbs* in major Chinese steel regions like Shanxi and Tangshan have been implemented, affecting overall output. 
- Key suppliers Australia and Brazil have reduced *iron ore shipments*, despite BHP's efforts to establish a more sustainable iron industry.

items.title: Birla Tyres Resumes Operations with New Ownership
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- **Birla Tyres** has restarted production at its Balasore plant under new ownership, beginning with *10% capacity utilization*.
- The company plans to diversify its portfolio, focusing on *passenger car radial* and *electric vehicle tyres*, while maintaining significant presence in commercial vehicle tyres.
- The brand aims to expand its footprint by entering new states and initiating exports to the *Middle East* and *Africa*.

items.title: Maruti Engine Sputters Amid Small Car Woes
items.author: Shally Mohile, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Maruti Suzuki's small car production has hit a *five-year low* due to declining demand. 
- A significant shift towards *SUVs* and premium models has impacted sales in the small car segment. 
- Industry experts suggest that tighter *regulations* on emissions and a lack of new models have made small cars less attractive to consumers.

items.title: Trump Says Coca-Cola Will Use Real Cane Sugar
items.summary:
- *Donald Trump* claims that Coca-Cola has agreed to use **real cane sugar** in its products, describing it as a "good move".
- The company has not yet confirmed this agreement, leaving the details uncertain.
- Trump’s history with Coca-Cola is notable, including a fascination with *Diet Coke*, which he reportedly consumed in large quantities.

items.title: Hinduja Group Eyes Strategic Investments in Uttar Pradesh
items.author: Online Bureau
items.summary:
- The *Hinduja Group* is exploring opportunities in *electric mobility*, *energy*, and financial services in Uttar Pradesh.
- The group aims to support initiatives like an *EV charging network* and to enhance local banking and digital media infrastructure.
- This move is part of Uttar Pradesh's strategy to bolster private sector involvement in achieving a *$1 trillion economy*.

items.title: Ashok Leyland to Begin EV Bus Production in Lucknow
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- Ashok Leyland's electric bus manufacturing facility in Lucknow will start production within two months.  
- The Hinduja Group, which leads the initiative, has completed construction in *just 18 months*.  
- Discussions during recent meetings indicate *strategic partnerships* in renewable energy and digital connectivity to strengthen the EV ecosystem.

items.title: Indigenous AEW&C Project Approved for Development
items.author: Manu Pubby, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- The Indian government has approved the production of next-generation *airborne early warning and control systems* (Awacs India), enhancing the Indian Air Force's capabilities.
- The project, costing approximately ₹20,000 crore, involves integrating advanced systems on A321 aircraft with other Indian companies and Airbus.
- This initiative marks a significant step for India's homegrown defense production and could lead to future *export opportunities*.

items.title: Indigenous AWACS Development Approved
items.author: Manu Pubby, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- The Indian government has approved the development of **next-generation AWACS** to enhance the capabilities of the Indian Air Force.
- The project will involve six large AWACS aircraft, costing around ₹20,000 crore, supported by DRDO and other Indian companies.
- This indigenous program, also known as **Netra MkII**, marks a significant step in India's defence manufacturing, potentially opening up future **export opportunities**.

items.title: Thermal investments in India to jump 2-fold to Rs 2.3 lakh crore in next 3 fiscals
Apple's Record iPhone Production in India
items.author: Subhrojit Mallick, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Apple achieved a *53% increase* in iPhone production in India during H1 2025, totaling *23.9 million units*.
- The sharp rise in exports reflects India's emergence as a *key manufacturing hub* for Apple, supported by *Production Linked Incentive (PLI)* schemes.
- Foxconn and Tata Electronics lead iPhone production, with Apple planning simultaneous manufacturing of the upcoming *iPhone 17* in both India and China.

items.title: Trump Hints at New Trade Deal with India
items.summary:
- *Trump hints* at a potential trade agreement with India during a meeting with Bahrain’s Crown Prince.
- The proposed deal could follow the recently finalized agreement with Indonesia, emphasizing market access.
- Concerns arise over potential *uneven benefits*, with experts urging caution to protect India's domestic sectors.

items.title: Rolls-Royce expands US manufacturing with $75 mn investment in South Carolina
True Power's ₹100 Crore Solar Factory in Barabanki
items.summary:
- True Power Limited is constructing a *₹100 crore* solar panel manufacturing facility in Barabanki, aiming for *1 GW* annual production capacity.
- This investment will create hundreds of direct jobs, enhancing the local economy and supporting India's *renewable energy* goals.
- The project bolsters Uttar Pradesh’s ambitions for *20,000 MW of renewable energy* by 2027, fostering green innovation and energy independence.

items.title: Thermo Fisher acquires Sanofi's New Jersey manufacturing site
items.summary:
- *Thermo Fisher* will purchase Sanofi's manufacturing facility in Ridgefield, New Jersey to produce *critical medicines*.
- This move aligns with Sanofi's expansion in the U.S. due to tariff pressures influenced by *Donald Trump*.
- The acquisition aims to enhance U.S. manufacturing capabilities, adding around 200 employees to Thermo Fisher's team.

items.title: AccerMittal Nippon Steel India commissions new line at Hazira plant to produce high-strength steel
Hindustan Zinc receives govt approval for potash block in Rajasthan
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Hindustan Zinc* has received a Letter of Intent for a potash block in Rajasthan, marking a key step in the *critical minerals sector*.
- This 1,800-hectare block is one of the first allocated in India and aims to reduce the country's reliance on imported potash for *NPK fertilizers*.
- The acquisitions align with Hindustan Zinc’s strategy to enhance mineral self-reliance and boost domestic resource development.

items.title: Cabinet approves ₹20,000 crore investment plan for NTPC’s renewable energy expansion
items.author: Saurav Anand
items.summary:
- The Cabinet has approved an investment of *₹20,000 crore* for NTPC's renewable energy projects, increasing its investment ceiling from *₹7,500 crore*.
- This plan aims to boost NTPC’s capacity to *60 GW by 2032* and enhance India’s renewable energy infrastructure.
- It is expected to generate significant *employment opportunities* and support local enterprises and socio-economic development.

items.title: Hindustan Zinc adopts AI to improve production efficiency
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Hindustan Zinc* has implemented an *AI-powered automation tool* to optimize smelting operations by improving the dosing of chemical compounds.
- The initiative aims to minimize manual intervention and enhance operational efficiency by using real-time analytics and machine learning.
- The company is collaborating with over 40 startups to drive *digital transformation* and innovate across various projects related to efficiency and sustainability.

items.title: Sentient Governance: A strategic operating philosophy for real-time oversight
Localisation in Manufacturing Amid Global Tariff War
items.author: Shekhar Jitkar, ETManufacturing
items.summary:
- *India's push for localisation* aims to strengthen domestic capabilities, create jobs, and enhance economic resilience amidst global tariff tensions.
- The US-China *trade war* has shifted manufacturing strategies, prompting countries to reduce dependency on single sources like China.
- Government initiatives such as *Atmanirbhar Bharat* and *Make in India* are key to boosting domestic manufacturing and export competitiveness.

items.title: Zimbabwe to Begin $270M Lithium Plant Construction
items.summary:
- *Kuvimba Mining House* plans to construct a $270 million lithium plant at *Sandawana mine* in Q3 2025, seeking commissioning by early 2027.
- The plant, partnering with **Chinese metals giants**, aims to produce 600,000 metric tons of lithium concentrate annually.
- Zimbabwe expects lithium prices to recover by 2027, coinciding with the plant's operation, and plans to ban exports of lithium concentrates to boost local processing.

items.title: True Power's ₹100 Crore Solar Factory in Barabanki
items.summary:
- **True Power Limited** has started constructing a **₹100 crore** solar panel plant in **Barabanki**, Uttar Pradesh, which aims to produce **1 GW** of solar panels annually.
- This facility is projected to create hundreds of jobs, significantly supporting the local economy and contributing to India’s energy independence.
- The project aligns with Uttar Pradesh's **ambitious renewable energy goals**, aiming for **20,000 MW** by 2027, and supports national efforts towards achieving **net-zero emissions**.

items.title: ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel India commissions new line at Hazira plant to produce high-strength steel
items.summary:
- AMNS India has inaugurated a *new production line* at its Hazira plant in Gujarat for producing *high-strength steel* for the automotive sector.
- The line is part of a Rs 60,000 crore investment project aimed at enhancing production capacity and technological advancements in Indian steel manufacturing.
- This development marks AMNS India as the *first in the country* to manufacture the highest strength steel, significantly contributing to India's *self-reliance* in this domain.

items.title: Japanese Firms Keen to Invest in India's Textiles Sector
items.summary:
- *Japanese companies* are eager to explore investment opportunities in India's textiles sector, as highlighted by AEPC chair Sudhir Sekhri.
- The India Tex Trend Fair in Tokyo showcased *collaborations* between various firms, including successful meetings with major brands like Uniqlo and Daiso.
- With only 1% of Japan's $23 billion apparel imports coming from India, there's significant potential for *increased garment exports* if compliance with Japanese quality standards is achieved.

items.title: Cabinet approves ₹20,000 crore investment plan for NTPC’s renewable energy expansion
Specta to commission new quartz manufacturing facility in Jaipur
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Specta*, launched in 2023, will open a new manufacturing facility in Jaipur with a production capacity of **30,000 square feet** of quartz slabs per day.
- The facility will introduce **7mm ultra-thin quartz** and offer larger slab sizes, aiming to meet growing demands in the Indian premium housing market.
- This expansion is expected to generate **150 jobs** and help Specta achieve a revenue target of ₹300 crore by FY26.

items.title: Google Inks $3 Billion US Hydropower Deal
items.summary:
- Google has signed a **$3 billion** deal for up to *3 gigawatts* of US hydropower, marking the largest corporate clean power pact for hydroelectricity.
- The agreement includes a **20-year** power purchase for electricity generated from two Pennsylvania hydropower facilities.
- Google aims to allocate **$25 billion** for data centers in the region over two years, highlighting the tech industry's demand for clean energy.

items.title: Rajasthan to attract ₹11,200 crore investments as Cabinet clears formation of three energy sector JVs
Apple's $500M Deal for Rare Earth Magnets
items.summary:
- Apple signed a **$500 million** agreement with MP Materials for a reliable supply of *rare earth magnets* amid supply chain uncertainties.
- The deal ensures a steady flow of magnets not dependent on *Chinese exports*, addressing long-term supply risks.
- By prioritizing *U.S.-based suppliers*, Apple strengthens its position against political pressures while supporting domestic production of essential materials.

items.title: Ocior Energy Wins Green Hydrogen Deal with HPCL
items.author: Kalpana Pathak, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- *Ocior Energy* will supply **5,000 tonnes** of *green hydrogen* annually to HPCL's Visakhapatnam refinery.
- The project operates on a 25-year build, own, and operate basis, with hydrogen priced at **₹328 per kg**.
- This initiative aims to transition from grey to green hydrogen, making HPCL's operations more *sustainable*.

items.title: Dixon Ties Up with Two Chinese Companies
items.author: Subhrojit Mallick, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Dixon Technologies is investing Rs 1,000 crore to enhance manufacturing of *camera and fingerprint modules* with Chinese firms.
- A joint venture with *Chongqing Yuhai Precision Manufacturing* will focus on precision components production, ensuring *localization* in various industries.
- The majority stake acquisition in *Kunshan Q Tech* marks a significant step for Dixon in expanding its component manufacturing capabilities.

items.title: Engineering a Viksit Bharat with Rail Innovation
items.author: Prithish Chowdhary, ETManufacturing
items.summary:
- Indian Railways, a critical economic backbone, is evolving with *digital intelligence* and *private sector participation*.
- The government's ₹1.16 lakh crore safety allocation is boosting technologies like the *Kavach* collision avoidance system.
- Infrastructure investments foster a multiplier effect, linking railways to over 250 industries, underlining the vision of a *Viksit Bharat*.

items.title: Trump Proposes High Tariffs on Pharmaceuticals
items.summary:
- President Trump hints at imposing tariffs on pharmaceuticals, potentially reaching *200%* after a one-year grace period for companies to adjust.
- These tariffs are aimed at encouraging the return of manufacturing to the US and are expected to affect major drugmakers and consumer prices.
- Trump is also exploring trade agreements with several countries, including *India*, before the tariffs take effect on *August 1*.

items.title: Trump Signals Possible Pharmaceutical Tariffs
items.summary:
- *Donald Trump* indicated that tariffs on *pharmaceutical imports* might be implemented by the end of the month. 
- The administration plans to start with a low tariff, escalating to as high as *200%* after a year to encourage domestic production. 
- Similar timelines for tariffs on *semiconductors* have also been proposed, with national security concerns driving the investigations under the *Trade Expansion Act of 1962*.

items.title: GM's $4 Billion Investment in Gas Trucks and SUVs
items.summary:
- GM is investing *$4 billion* to increase production of gas-powered trucks and SUVs, including the *Cadillac Escalade* and *Chevrolet Silverado*.
- This decision comes amid reduced goals for electric vehicle production due to weaker demand projections.
- The shift, expected to begin in *2027*, raises questions about GM's commitment to phasing out gas vehicles by *2035*.

items.title: India's Electronics Boom Offsets Slump in Traditional Exports
items.summary:
- India's electronics exports increased by *47.1%* to *USD 2.8 billion*, driven by rising shipments of smartphones.
- Traditional exports, particularly gems and jewellery, saw a decline of *20.4%*, reflecting softening global demand.
- This trade data marks a significant *structural transformation* in India's export profile, favoring high-import-intensity sectors like *electronics*.

items.title: Kerala: 5,500 crore condoms manufactured in six decades, mini-ratna PSU going strong
Maharashtra to become country's largest EV manufacturing hub, says CM Fadnavis
Hindustan Motors alleges unlawful takeover of Uttarpara plant by West Bengal govt
India's GCC Hiring Rebounds by 8-10% in Q1 FY26
items.summary:
- India's *Global Capability Centres (GCCs)* experienced an **8-10%** rise in hiring in Q1 FY26 after a decline in Q4 FY25.
- The shift in focus is towards *high-value skills* in areas like AI and cybersecurity, with significant demand from sectors such as *BFSI, Manufacturing,* and *Technology*.
- Tier-2 cities are emerging as key players, with Coimbatore seeing a **34.10%** increase in demand, yet they still face challenges in meeting talent needs.

items.title: Defence Ministry takes steps for indigenisation of UAV, C-UAS technologies
Premium liquor demand up in UP
items.summary:
- *Demand for premium liquor* in Uttar Pradesh has been increasing significantly, with a 32% CAGR for imported categories from 2019 to 2024.
- The overall market value of the alcoholic beverages industry in UP is estimated at **Rs 56,000 crore** as of FY 2023-24, generating substantial excise revenue.
- Consumers are increasingly favoring *high-quality liquor*, leading to a shift in market dynamics towards premium and higher-taxed segments.

items.title: Maharashtra Signs MoUs for Hydropower Projects
items.summary:
- The Maharashtra government signed four **MoUs** with private firms for **pumped storage hydropower projects** worth ₹31,955 crore.  
- These projects aim to generate **6,450 MW** of power and create **15,000 jobs**.  
- The state plans to achieve over **50% of its electricity** from renewable sources by **2030**, driving towards net-zero carbon emissions.

items.title: Maharashtra govt signs MoUs for 4 pumped storage hydropower projects with Rs 31,955 cr investment
India to become a global employment epicenter amid shift in global labour market: Crisil
items.summary:
- India is poised to be a *global employment epicenter* as demand for *skilled workers* grows due to demographic shifts.
- The country has 65% of its population under 35, positioning it to help bridge the *global skills shortage*.
- Immediate attention is needed to address *skill gaps* to enhance employability and productivity domestically.

items.title: Nissan Closes Its Oppama Plant in Japan
items.summary:
- Nissan is closing its *flagship factory* in Oppama by March 2028 to cut costs. 
- The closure impacts 2,400 employees, with promises for fair treatment and transfer offers. 
- This decision is part of Nissan's strategy to consolidate production and overcome financial losses, which include a recent $4.5 billion loss in the fiscal year.

items.title: Specta to invest ₹250 cr to nearly treble production capacity
